I can provide you with some insights on this issue. the cost of gene therapy has been a significant barrier to its widespread adoption and access. currently, most gene therapies on the market are expensive and can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars or even more for a single treatment, leading to concerns about affordability and accessibility.

however, the cost of gene therapy is expected to decrease as the technology advances and more therapies are developed, which could make it more accessible to a larger population. additionally, there are ongoing efforts to make gene therapy more affordable and accessible, such as through government funding and incentives, collaborations between biotech companies and healthcare providers to reduce costs, and the development of innovative payment models.

it is also worth noting that gene therapy has the potential to be a cost-effective treatment option in the long run as it can potentially cure or provide long-term relief for certain diseases, which could reduce healthcare costs associated with ongoing treatments and hospitalizations. 

so, while the cost of gene therapy is currently a concern, there are efforts being made to address this and it is possible that with the continued advancement of science and technology, gene therapy could become more affordable and accessible for more people in the future.
